Cheng-Cher Huang Cheng-Cher Huang Cheng-Cher Huang Professor,
				School of Physics and Astronomy 612-624-0861 huang001@umn.edu Physics And Nanotechnology Building Liquid Crystal Group Ph.D., University of Pennsylvania, 1975 B.Sc., National Taiwan University, Taipei, 1969 Our research is focused on smectic liquid crystal systems, mainly chiral antiferroelectric liquid crystal compounds and their mixtures. Liquid crystals are systems that have symmetries intermediate between the crystalline solid and the isotropic liquid. Thus they are often called "Partially ordered systems". "Smectic" comes from the Greek word "σμηγμα", which means soap. Indeed smectic liquid crystals have layered structure just like soap solution. Liquid Crystal Group website C. C.
